gcci.text: At $3.21/hr for H100s, utilization remains the key lever; constrained supply is pushing capex into co-location while vendors hedge with spot resale to smooth cash flow.

gtpi.text: With input tokens at $1.25/1M, price pressure is forcing providers to push higher‑efficiency architectures and caching, while competitors race on throughput to defend margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load implies ~13.7 GW continuous draw, intensifying grid strain and carbon accounting—accelerating siting near low‑carbon baseload and demand‑response contracts.

aipi.text: Capital intensity is rising alongside rapid capacity additions; sentiment remains buoyant but investors increasingly scrutinize utilization contracts and long‑run profitability to manage bubble risk.
